front.div:
Abstract. Abstract prototypes are an intermediate form that can speed
the user interface design process and improve the quality of the results.
Abstract prototypes help bridge the conceptual gap between a task model
and a representational paper prototype for a user interface design. This
short article introduces abstract prototypes in the form of simple content
inventories and content navigation maps. An example illustrates the
process of using abstract prototypes and suggests the possible
advantages over other prototyping techniques.
